turns.speaker: agent

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the last four digits are 4567 and my birthday is 03/15/1988. Ugh, I hate having to do this every time.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account information. Okay, your current checking account balance is $452.18. I do see a payment of $75 to Acme Corp processed on January 26th. Was there anything else?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Great, the payment went through. I also wanted to ask, why is my monthly service fee so high? It seems like it keeps going up. It's currently $15.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The monthly service fee can vary depending on your account type and balance. I am showing you have a 'Basic Checking' account. Fees are typically waived for balances over $500. Let me see if there are any current promotions for different account types that might be beneficial for you.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: So, if I keep over $500, the fee is waived? What if it dips below for a day or two, like around when bills are due? Will I get charged the fee anyway?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question. While the exact policy can be found in your account agreement, generally, the fee is based on the average daily balance for the month. So, dipping below $500 for a short period might not trigger the fee, but consistently being below could. I recommend reviewing your account agreement for the specific details related to your account.
